required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of an Alternative Injection Paradigm for OnabotulinumtoxinA (BOTOX®) in the Treatment of Overactive Bladder in Patients With Urinary Incontinence
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel-Group Study to Evaluate an Alternative Injection Paradigm for OnabotulinumtoxinA (BOTOX®) in the Treatment of Overactive Bladder in Patients With Urinary Incontinence (LO-BOT)

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the efficacy and safety of onabotulinumtoxinA 100 U (BOTOX®), compared to placebo, when injected into the bladder using an alternative injection paradigm in reducing the number of daily urinary incontinence episodes in patients with overactive bladder (OAB) and urinary incontinence whose symptoms have not been adequately managed with an anticholinergic.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Daily Average Number of Urinary Incontinence Episodes
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (3 consecutive days during the Screening Period; within 35 days prior to Day 1) to 3 consecutive days prior to Week 12
primary_outcome.description: The participant recorded urinary incontinence in a 3-day bladder diary. Data for the three days was averaged. A negative change from Baseline indicates improvement. An analysis of covariance (ANCOVA) model with treatment as a factor at 2 levels, and the number of Urgency Urinary Incontinence (UUI) episodes reported at Baseline (<= 9 versus > 9 daily episodes) and Baseline daily average number of episodes of incontinence as covariates was used for analyses.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved Complete Continence
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (3 consecutive days during the Screening Period; within 35 days prior to Day 1) to 3 consecutive days prior to Week 12]
secondary_outcome.description: Complete continence is defined as 100% reduction in urinary incontinence from Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Daily Average Number of Micturition Episodes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (3 consecutive days during the Screening Period; within 35 days prior to Day 1) to 3 consecutive days prior to Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: The participant recorded the number of micturition episodes in a 3-day bladder diary. Data for the three days was averaged. A negative change from Baseline indicates improvement. An ANCOVA model with treatment as a factor at 2 levels, and the number of UUI episodes reported at Baseline (<= 9 versus > 9 daily episodes) and Baseline daily average number of micturition as covariates was used for analyses.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Daily Average Number of Urgency Episodes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (3 consecutive days during the Screening Period; within 35 days prior to Day 1) to 3 consecutive days prior to Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: The participant recorded the number of urgency episode in a 3-day bladder diary. Data for the three days was averaged. A negative change from Baseline indicates improvement. An ANCOVA model with treatment as a factor at 2 levels, and the number of UUI episodes reported at Baseline (<= 9 versus > 9 daily episodes) and Baseline daily average number of urgency episodes as covariates was used for analyses.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Daily Average Number of Nocturia Episodes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (3 consecutive days during the Screening Period; within 35 days prior to Day 1) to, 3 consecutive days prior to Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: The participants recorded the number of nocturia episodes in a 3-day bladder diary. Data for the three days was averaged. A negative change from Baseline indicates improvement. An ANCOVA model with treatment as a factor at 2 levels, and the number of UUI episodes reported at Baseline (<= 9 versus > 9 daily episodes) and Baseline daily average number of nocturia episodes as covariates was used for analyses.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Have a Positive Treatment Response on the Treatment Benefit Scale (TBS)
secondary_outcome.description: The participant rated their condition during treatment using the TBS 4-point scale where: 1=greatly improved, 2=improved, 3=not changed or 4=worsened. A positive treatment response is either as score of 1=greatly improved or 2=improved.

arm_group.description: BOTOX® (onabotulinumtoxinA) 100 U injection into the bladder on Day 1 and a second injection BOTOX® 100 U after Week 12 if applicable.
Placebo (saline) injection into the bladder on Day 1 and a second injection BOTOX® 100 U after Week 12 if applicable.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participant weighs ≥ 40 kg (88 lb)
- Participant has symptoms of Over Active Bladder (OAB) (frequency and urgency) with urinary incontinence for a period of at least 6 months immediately prior to screening.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participant has symptoms of OAB due to any known neurological reason (eg, spinal cord injury, multiple sclerosis, cerebrovascular accident, Alzheimer's disease, Parkinson's disease, etc.)
- Participant has received pharmacologic therapy to treat symptoms of OAB, including nocturia, within 7 days of the start of the screening period procedures
- Participant uses clean intermittent catheterization (CIC) or indwelling catheter to manage urinary incontinence
- Participant has been treated with any intravesical pharmacologic agent (eg, capsaicin, resiniferatoxin) within 12 months of Day 1
- Participant has had previous or current botulinum toxin therapy of any serotype for any urological condition
- Participant has had previous or current botulinum toxin therapy of any serotype for any non-urological condition within 12 weeks of Day 1
- Participant has been immunized for any botulinum toxin serotype
- Participant has history or evidence of any pelvic or urological abnormalities, bladder surgery or disease, other than OAB, that may affect bladder function
- Participant has an active genital infection, other than genital warts, either concurrently or within 4 weeks prior to screening
- Participant has a history or current diagnosis of bladder cancer or other urothelial malignancy
- Participant is male with previous or current diagnosis of prostate cancer
- Participant has a history of 2 or more urinary tract infections (UTIs) within 6 months of Day 1 or is taking prophylactic antibiotics to prevent chronic UTIs
- Participant has current or previous uninvestigated hematuria
- Participant has hemophilia, or other clotting factor deficiencies, or disorders that cause bleeding diathesis
- Participant cannot withhold any antiplatelet, anticoagulant therapy or medications with anticoagulant effects for 3 days prior to Day 1
- Participant has a known allergy or sensitivity to any botulinum toxin preparation
- Participant has any medical condition that may put him/her at increased risk with exposure to BOTOX® including diagnosed myasthenia gravis, Eaton-Lambert syndrome, or amyotrophic lateral sclerosis
- Participant has current swallowing or breathing difficulties.

facility.name: University of California, Irvine Medical Center
East Coast Institute for Research, LLC
Advanced Urology Centers of NY A division of IMP
Premier Medical Group of the Hudson Valley

group.title: BOTOX® 100 U/BOTOX® 100 U
group.description: BOTOX® (onabotulinumtoxinA) 100 U injection into the bladder on Day 1 in the Double-Blind Treatment Period and a second injection BOTOX® 100 U after Week 12 if applicable in the Open-Label Re-Treatment Period.

group.title: Placebo/BOTOX® 100 U
group.description: Placebo (saline) injection into the bladder on Day 1 in the Double-Blind Treatment Period and a second injection BOTOX® 100 U after Week 12 if applicable in the Open-Label Re-Treatment Period.

baseline.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT) Population included all randomized participants.

group.title: BOTOX® 100 U/BOTOX® 100 U

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Daily Average Number of Urinary Incontinence Episodes
measure.description: The participant recorded urinary incontinence in a 3-day bladder diary. Data for the three days was averaged.
measure.population: Modified Intent-to-treat (mITT) Population included all randomized participants who had at least one efficacy assessment at Baseline and a postbaseline visit.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Daily Average Number of Urinary Incontinence Episodes
outcome.description: The participant recorded urinary incontinence in a 3-day bladder diary. Data for the three days was averaged. A negative change from Baseline indicates improvement. An analysis of covariance (ANCOVA) model with treatment as a factor at 2 levels, and the number of Urgency Urinary Incontinence (UUI) episodes reported at Baseline (<= 9 versus > 9 daily episodes) and Baseline daily average number of episodes of incontinence as covariates was used for analyses.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (3 consecutive days during the Screening Period; within 35 days prior to Day 1) to 3 consecutive days prior to Week 12
outcome.population: Modified Intent-to-treat (mITT) Population included all randomized participants who had at least one efficacy assessment at Baseline and a postbaseline visit.

outcome.time_frame: Baseline (3 consecutive days during the Screening Period; within 35 days prior to Day 1) to 3 consecutive days prior to Week 12]
outcome.population: mITT Population included all randomized participants who had at least one efficacy assessment at Baseline and a postbaseline visit. Number analyzed is the number of participants with data available for analyses at the given timepoint.

group.title: BOTOX® 100 U/BOTOX® 100 U
group.description: BOTOX® (onabotulinumtoxinA) 100 U injection into the bladder on Day 1 in the Double-Blind Treatment Period and a second injection BOTOX® 100 U after Week 12 if applicable in the Open-Label Re-Treatment Period.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved Complete Continence
measure.description: Complete continence is defined as 100% reduction in urinary incontinence from Baseline.
measure.population: mITT Population included all randomized participants who had at least one efficacy assessment at Baseline and a postbaseline visit. Number analyzed is the number of participants with data available for analyses at the given timepoint.

analysis.estimate_desc: Values obtained were from a Cochran Mantel-Haenszel test adjusting for the number of UUI episodes reported at Baseline (<= 9 versus > 9 daily episodes)at each scheduled visit.

reported_events.time_frame: Randomization to the Study Exit Visit (Up to 70 Weeks)
reported_events.desc: ITT population, all randomized participants, was used to determine the number at risk for All-Cause Mortality. Safety Population, all participants who received study drug, was used to determine the number of participants at risk for Adverse Events.

group.title: Double Blind: BOTOX® 100 U
group.description: BOTOX® (onabotulinumtoxinA) 100 U injection into the bladder on Day 1 in the Double-Blind Treatment Period.

group.title: Double Blind: Placebo
group.description: Placebo (saline) injection into the bladder on Day 1 in the Double-Blind Treatment Period.

group.title: Open Label: BOTOX® 100 U/BOTOX® 100 U
group.description: BOTOX® (onabotulinumtoxinA) 100 U injection into the bladder in the Open-Label Re-Treatment Period in participants who previously received BOTOX® (onabotulinumtoxinA) 100 U injection into the bladder on Day 1.

group.title: Open Label: Placebo/BOTOX® 100 U
group.description: BOTOX® (onabotulinumtoxinA) 100 U injection into the bladder in the Open-Label Re-Treatment Period in participants who previously received Placebo (saline) injection into the bladder on Day 1.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
